column4: taylor04->  use  sudo ifup eth0  instead to bring up the interface
-- ifconfig up and ifup are not the same thing!
- ifup = ifdown -- how do you know what state the adapter is in?
- What -- b43 driver not bcm43xx
-- Im not arguing -- what is line 3?
--product: BCM4311 802.11b/g WLAN - line 3?
-- Where you getting bcm43xx?
What are you getting at?  I'm running 4306
bcm43xx were the old drivers, b43 are the new drivers
That is my point, was using b43 drivers -- and not the bcm43xx drivers.  bcm43xx drivers were for old kernel versions
-- see your around
-- yes -- was shot dead or something crazy like that
-- That is what it reports however I actually using b43 -- with the opensource openfwwf firmware.
Here are the instructions I followed: http://linuxfans.betaserver.org/
And yes I guess I did some compiling you could say:)
Here is a pretty good up-to-date list on what chipset and what drivers -- Please note that the old bcm43xx driver (the one everyone used to use) is dead!
Here is the list: http://linuxfans.betaserver.org/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=46:broadcom-guide-for-ubuntu-hardy-and-newer&catid=34:guides&Itemid=61
You'll be surprised with b43 on the newer kernel -- full 54mbs support
Never used the STA driver !!!  But at least you can dump the unreliable bcm43xx -- and ndiswrapper -- had its day but now its done!
-- The jaunty kernel will be even better since you wil be able to use channels 12.13,14 with a workaround :)
Dont tell anyone!
And of course I was referring to use in Japan BTW :p
